title: Make Selected Champions unbanable in ranked?
body:
My friend and I duo botlane in ranked.  He mains Gnar and I main soraka.  Yes Gnar adc.  His skill level is around mid to high gold and as of writing this he has 771,000 mastery points on gnar.  I probably don't have to explain to you that we're doing just fine in low silver right now.  But there's always the doubting teammate.  The one guy who decides gnar adc isn't viable and either locks him in the lane he's picking or bans him just to spite us.  We always dodge when it happens and it's like 20% of our games.  Gnar and soraka is our thing and we're very successful doing it.

So that's my sob story.  It doesn't make any sense that you can ban the champion your teammate has selected.  Please remove this feature.  Thanks

replies.body:
no.

Example use: When zoe was pick or ban... or any champ that was pick or ban.




Scenario:  Our last pick wants to play "insert op broken champion that must be picked or banned here" but obv the enemy team is gonna get him/her first, but team hovered him/her. 

Banned. end of story. 


Teammate: "waaaaa i wanted to play "-".

You were last pick and knew damn well you weren't getting that champ.

Your argument is reliant on two premises:
1.  A champion in league of legends is pick or ban
2.  A teammate is willing to jeopardize the game on the off chance he gets this champion

Neither of these are ideal scenarios in league.  I understand that they happen once in a while but only once in a while.  The game is designed to prevent this from happening.  You're basically assuming that since problems like these might exist it's best to allow players power over each other rather than fixing the problem.  This is faulty logic.  The obvious solution is to just fix the problem.  Players who jeopardize their team will lose more games.  Champions that are pick/ban get nerfed.  Now what about the 99.9% of other league games?

1. you cant make ask for your argument without the fact that at any given patch... any given champ can be pick/ban.


So you cant want one idea without the possibility of the other happening.

And?  What's your point?  I agree it's a problem that a last pick player has power over his team to screw them over by picking a pick/ban champ and disallowing it from being banned.  But what you're saying is that the solution is more power in the hands of players?  Now you want to give the rest of the team power over each other's champions?  Isn't this the very problem you mentioned?

How do you solve a power struggle by giving everyone more power?  The answer is very clear: you don't.  You take away everyone's power over each other and put it back into their own hands.  

Good:
I get to chose my champion, you get to chose your own champion. 

Bad: I get to chose what champion you play, you get to chose what champion I play

Get the picture?

I think there should be a patch to make it so your own team can't ban or pick what you've already selected and to me, your "scenario" is a pretty useless excuse tbh. This game is supposed to be team oriented and if YOUR team doesn't like what you have selected, then they should ask if they can first pick for you so the other team doesn't get the champion instead of just banning off the champion you desired without asking. I think it's pretty clear that your champion hasn't been banned off or troll picked by your own team enough for you to wrap your tiny little brain around this.

1. Gnar is almost never picked or banned.
2. My friend and I work well in bot as Gnar and soraka and have a 71% win rate in ranked.
3. My own team bans or takes Gnar because they don't think Gnar works in bot or they just don't want me taking Gnar bot.
Having a team mate pick the champ I want before I get to pick or banning that champ just to spite my really makes me mad and why I dodge. Riot should make it so team mates can't ban team mates champs to prevent this.

1. at one point he was, and can easily with a couple tweaks end up as pick/ban again.
2. it doesn't matter how well you and your friend do, the situation is still no different.
3. oh well, if they don't like it tell your friend to have a backup pick.


and no they shouldn't.

I totally agree with you. I main Veigar support, which is actually really strong in the meta right now. However, the pick rate is low and many low elo players aren't aware of how strong he is bot with the new ap items. I've had people ban or threaten to ban my one trick cuz they "don't like it."
See if I'm ever trying to do something like that I don't show my pick intent and it's not _too_ much an issue. If they grumble or dodge it's w/e
We tried this as well but our team occasionally ends up banning our pick since we don't have it selected...
